title: Alana Arden
author: Alana Arden
content: For several days, I have been hearing a lot of buzz about Bitcoin on various online platforms and social media. Although I had no idea about Bitcoin,  so I didn't bother with it.But one day, suddenly, after learning about the importance of Bitcoin from my friends, I became very interested in Bitcoin.That's why, from now on, I want to know and learn more about Bitcoin. Although it must be said that my interest was born quite late, I am still glad that it was not too late.I hope I can learn more about Bitcoin from this community, and the community will help me learn it.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: There are many sources to learn about Bitcoin not only here on the forum.If you want to learn more about Bitcoin check the few links below it is a good start to learn about Bitcoin.- https://learnmeabitcoin.com/- https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Main_Page- https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook/blob/develop/book.asciidocFor developing Bitcoin you can check this link below.- https://github.com/igorbarinov/awesome-bitcoin

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Well it's better to be late than not joining at all, the interest is the first step and you should know you would be required to put in good amount of work to see you achieve what you are aiming at achieving right now. There are many ways to learn about Bitcoin and this forum is a very important part of the process but do not be limited only to the forum. Since you are here I think your should start with some helpful post and also try to learn about Crypto-currency in general.Terminology: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=126798.0Bitcoin wallet: yhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1631151.0 And as a newbie you should read this: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0Just enjoy the process as you grow you would learn more too.

comments.author: Egii Nna
comments.body: You are welcome, mate. It is good to hear that you finally understand bitcoin now a bit, which means you are at the right place to explore and learn more about bitcoin. And again, mate, don’t hesitate to ask questions at any time in any aspect you don’t understand. In bitcoin, we have other high-ranking and highly knowledgeable members that will help you out in any difficulty.What I can help you with now is to share some links that I also use to read more about bitcoin. Which I used to have my own experience so that you can also achieve what I have achieved so farYou can click Newbies read before posting it will guide on how to operate on the forum. Also you can click Everything you need to know about forum activities,account ranks,merit system  You can use this Beginners encyclopediaThis link can help to to explore more about the forum and also bitcoin

comments.body: Welcome to the forum.To avoid being exposed to the noise, read good articles on the subject.Knowledge to help you argue with bitcoin criticsTo learn more about bitcoin, forum and cryptocurrencies, read good articles in the collected collection of useful topics.Beginners & Help Encyclopedia

comments.author: aylabadia05
comments.body: The three sites left by BitMaxz can be used as material for learning about Bitcoin. Save the link in notepad and read it often and study each passage carefully, especially regarding how Bitcoin works.Everything is explained well one by one about Bitcoin starting from what Bitcoin is, what problems Bitcoin solves etc.The topic Beginners & Help Encyclopedia created by Ratimov is also quite useful for your knowledge about Bitcoin.Welcome to the Bitcoin forum.

comments.author: darkangel11
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, hope you'll like it here.Quote from: Alana Arden on September 17, 2023, 05:16:39 PMFor several days, I have been hearing a lot of buzz about Bitcoin on various online platforms and social media.Interesting. Are people gearing up for the halving? Usually social media and the hype from people who weren't interested a year or two back are signs of a bull market. QuoteAlthough I had no idea about Bitcoin,  so I didn't bother with it.Learning is easy, you just need the will to do it and some time. QuoteAlthough it must be said that my interest was born quite late, I am still glad that it was not too late.Better late than never.

comments.body: Welcome!You can explore every section that we have here and it's got its description for you to check. And yes, this community is going to help you learn everything about it but of course, you need to initiate what you want to know through continuous reading.

I am just kind of surprised that you are just hearing about bitcoin recently. If you have been on social media before, I am sure you will have heard about bitcoin even before now, but you are not still late. Welcome to the forum, and all this necessary information that you need has already been provided for you. But make sure you don't plagiarize because that's one of the offenses that I notice is popular among the newbies on the forum here.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: You're not the only one who joined late and you're not the only one who also ask the same question if they are late or not to join in crypto. I always said to those who ask this question that they are not late and even all these years that Bitcoin existed, Bitcoin is still an experimental software which means there are more that can be added in ehe future. Also, be careful of someone on social media who gives am info that is not correct so better find another source of the same info to check if it is correct or not.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: It’s never too late to start your bitcoin journey, my story is quite similar to yours. It took me a long time before I exposed myself to the bitcoin world. The forum is a very good place to start, the discussions here are mostly about bitcoin so it’s easy for newbies to pick up the pace. I recommend you dedicate most of your screen time to reading educational threads on the forum. If you’re interested in YouTube videos, I recommend watching Andreas Antonopoulos bitcoin videos.

comments.author: Alana Arden
comments.body: I am grateful to everyone who helped me with various links to learn about Bitcoin.These links are very important, and reading them makes me thirsty to know about Bitcoin in a new way and increasing my knowledge base.I am trying to fully understand Bitcoin. I also believe that Bitcoin will make our days and lives easier and richer.    I'm new, so some posts in the group had some writing short forms that I didn't understand. But this link https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=126798.0  has helped me a lot, which I shared with everyone. I hope newbies like me will benefit from this link.
